alert.note: Alert for Atkinson; Brantley; Charlton (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 17 at 7:22AM EST by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1030 AM EST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Georgia, including the following counties, Atkinson, Brantley, Charlton, Clinch, Echols and Ware. * WHEN...Until 1030 AM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 721 AM EST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to persistent rain and shower activity. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Homerville, Pearson, Fargo, Argyle, Stephen Foster State Park, Statenville, Du Pont, Manor, Needmore, Cogdell, Mayday and Race Pond. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
